016
017package squidpony.squidai.astar;
018
019/** A {@code Heuristic} generates estimates of the cost to move from a given node to the goal.
020 * <p>
021 * With a heuristic function pathfinding algorithms can choose the node that is most likely to lead to the optimal path. The
022 * notion of "most likely" is controlled by a heuristic. If the heuristic is accurate, then the algorithm will be efficient. If
023 * the heuristic is terrible, then it can perform even worse than other algorithms that don't use any heuristic function such as
024 * Dijkstra.
025 * 
026 * @param <N> Type of node
027 * 
028 * @author davebaol */
029public interface Heuristic<N> {
030
031        /** Calculates an estimated cost to reach the goal node from the given node.
032         * @param node the start node
033         * @param endNode the end node
034         * @return the estimated cost */
035        float estimate(N node, N endNode);
036}
